intro: Endiandra tryphera, commonly known as the yellow rosewood, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and small, clustered white flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its valuable timber, it is often threatened by overharvesting and habitat loss.
